title: Lord Kerslake accused of breaking impartiality rules by advising Jeremy Corbyn while sitting as cross-bench peer
text:
A former head of the civil service who is now advising Jeremy Corbyn is under pressure to give up his status as a "crossbench" peer.

Senior Lords figures said Lord Kerslake appeared to be a "committed" Labour supporter despite sitting as an independent member of the upper House.

Baroness D'Souza, a former Lord Speaker, warned that crossbenchers, or non-party political peers, are expected to "remain politically unaffiliated".

Another crossbencher said Lord Kerslake's close involvement with Labour was a "serious problem" for the group of independent peers.

Lord Kerslake, 64, who was appointed as a crossbencher by David Cameron after serving as head of the civil service from 2012 to 2014, has been...
description: A former head of the civil service who is now advising Jeremy Corbyn is under pressure to give up his status as a "crossbench" peer.
